result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sherman Ladell McCullen

records.addlTxt: State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress and Brief in Support of State's Motion to Quash Defendant's Motion to Suppress, filed.

Defendant Sherman Ladell McCullen in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Sherman Ladell McCullen.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Status conference held.  Atty. Flynn requests a briefing schedule and motion date.  Court ordered the motion and a brief be filed with the court no later than 10/06/22; state to filed the response no later than 10/27/22.Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Sherman Ladell McCullen in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  
Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Flynn requests another status date so they can see if a DPA would be appropriate.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Sherman Ladell McCullen in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Flynn has just been appointed and requests another status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Sherman Ladell McCullen in court.  
Brandon Schwebler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  Defendant did not qualify for a public defender but is not working now.  Court ordered defendant to contact the SPD office to see if he qualifies.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Sherman Ladell McCullen in court.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.   Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.
DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 1.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/09/2022@1:00
